intro: Pallasia, commonly known as the small-flowered pallasia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of a single species, Pallasia microcarpa, which is native to the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers with white to pale yellow petals. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of the carrot family. Pallasia is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
